column3: Requirement
FUNCTIONAL
UAS shall determine autonomously how to position and navigate the aircraft to acquire a RGV.
column7: Acquire: Spotting a RGV during seach phase, prior to coarse localization.

column3: UAS shall determine autonomously how to position and navigate the aircraft to localize a RGV.
column7: Localize: Provide inertial estimate of RGV.

column3: UAS shall respond to flight operator inputs provided through the ground station UI to ensure safe execution of flight and tracking behaviors.
The aircraft shall take off from and land at a designated home base that is located at least 30 ft from the outer perimeter of the mission area.
UAS shall perform all autonomous motion within the designated mission environment.
UAS shall remain within visual line of sight (VLOS) of the operator.
The data collected during flight shall be stored or transmitted back to the operator and displayed on the ground station UI.
UAS shall complete all stages of the mission in a safe, controlled, and repeatable way.
UAS shall adhere to all applicable regulations concerning aviation and communication.
SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
All UAS motion, besides takeoff and landing, shall stay within the identified 150 ft x 150 ft environment.
column9: Use one of the senses to prove system meets requirements

column3: All UAS motion, besides takeoff and landing, shall be between 30-60 ft relative to the ground.
column9: Uses unit testing, modeling, and system knowledge

column3: UAS shall autonomously recognize and transition to the search phase as needed.
column9: Uses special test equipment and requires running multiple tests for data acquisitions

column3: UAS shall autonomously recognize and transition to the RGV trailing phase as needed.
column9: Runs a test without special equipment to collection data

column3: UAS shall autonomously recognize and transition to the coarse localization phase as needed.
UAS shall autonomously recognize and transition to the fine localization phase as needed.
UAS shall autonomously recognize and transition to the joint localization phase as needed.
UAS shall autonomously recognize when the mission has been completed.
UAS shall autonomously perform all motion planning necessary during the searching phase.
UAS shall autonomously perform all motion planning necessary during the trailing phase.
UAS shall autonomously perform all motion planning necessary during the coarse localization phase.
UAS shall autonomously perform all motion planning necessary during the fine localization phase.
UAS shall autonomously perform all motion planning necessary during the joint localization phase.
UAS shall autonomously interpret and send the necessary information to the user via a ground UI.
UAS shall have the capability to initiate and disengage the autonomous flight via a ground UI.
UAS shall perform all autonomous motion in a safe and controlled way.
UAS shall accommodate for the weight and size of the payloads
UAS shall provide necessary electrical power to all systems for a 15-minute flight
UAS shall provide the necessary computational power for all operations during a 15-minute flight
UAS shall provide the framework for manual flight
UAS shall provide the framework for autonomous flight
UAS shall have all necessary sensors to determine attitude

UAS shall be capable of transferring and recieving all necessary operational, flight, and sensor data to and from the 
ground station
UAS shall be capable of storing data that will be accessible at the end of the flight
UAS shall be able to maintain pace with both RGVs
UAS shall adhere to all relevant FAA and CU regulations
UAS shall display live aircraft states and desired RGV tracking artifacts to the operator at a ground control station through a user interface (UI).
UAS shall use a RGB camera as its primary sensor.
UAS shall have an onboard secondary sensor.
UAS shall be able to identify a given RGV during the search phase
UAS shall be able to continuously locate a given RGV during trailing
UAS shall be able to coarsely localize a given RGV for at least 60 seconds
UAS shall be able to finely localize a given RGV for at least 30 seconds
UAS shall be able to jointly localize both RGVs for at least 20 seconds
UAS shall adhere to all FCC regulations.
SUB-SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
LOOK AT THE AUTONOMY SUBTEAM GOOGLE DOC FOR BETTER FLOW DOWN FROM LVL 1s
All motion planning shall include horizontal plane bounds on UAS movement.
All motion planning shall include vertical axis bounds on UAS movement.
UAS shall recognize when a height of 30-60 ft relative to the ground is reached during the takeoff phase and will begin searching for RGVs.
UAS shall recognize when one RGV has been localized and will begin searching for any additional RGV.
UAS shall default to the search phase when no RGV is detected or when a UI overload control is deactivated.
UAS shall recognize when an initial RGV has been detected and will begin trailing the motion of the RGV.
UAS shall recognize when an additional RGV has been detected and will begin trailing the motion of the additional RGV, taking into account not to follow any prior localized RGVs.
UAS shall recognize when a tracked RGV stops its motion, characterized by a speed of less than TBD m/s, and will then begin coarse localization.
UAS shall recognize when an RGV has been coarsely localized for at least 60 seconds and will then begin fine localization.
UAS shall recognize when all RGVs have been finely localized for at least 30 seconds and will then begin joint localization on all RGVs.
UAS shall recognize when all RGVs have been jointly localized for at least 20 seconds and will register as mission complete.
UAS shall perform a celebratory maneuver upon successful completion.
UAS shall initiate the landing phase after mission completion.
UAS shall perform a designated search pattern to attempt to identify RGVs.
UAS shall perform the search pattern at a rate that ensures accurate sensing.
UAS shall always be less than 40 ft horizontal ground distance away from any RGV it is currently trailing.
UAS shall be able to follow RGV motion at speeds of up to 2 m/s.
UAS shall perform an orbiting flight path maneuver around the RGV it is coarse localizing.
UAS shall perform the orbiting flight path maneuver at a rate and path that informs accurate sensing.
UAS shall perform an informative flight path maneuver that will reduce RGV location error during fine localization by TBD amount.
UAS shall perform the informative flight path maneuver at a rate and path that informs accurate sensing.
UAS shall perform a joint localization flight path maneuver that will allow the capture of both RGVs by either the primary or secondary sensor.
UAS shall perform the joint localization flight path maneuver at a rate that ensures accurate sensing.
UI shall display a 2D map of the 150 ft x 150 ft environment.
UI shall display the current drone UAS location relative to the environment.
UI shall display an estimated state for acquired RGV location(s) at each stage of localization.
UI shall display the current phase of operation.
UI shall display a timer indicating the amount of time spent in the current phase.
UI shall have the ability to initiate the UAS mission, beginning the startup sequence.
UI shall have the ability to activate a hover mode for the UAS, stopping all motion and mission operations until deactivated.
UI shall have the ability to abort the UAS mission, commanding the UAS to return to base and land.
UI shall be able to switch the UAS control method to a manual handheld controller, deactivating the autonomous controller.
All UAS motion shall be limited to speeds of less than TBD m/s.
All UAS motion shall be limited to accelerations of less than TBD g’s.
Any UAS motion detected outside the defined mission area, besides takeoff and landing, shall be immediately aborted, and the UAS shall be set to hover mode.
UAS autonomous flight initiation shall occur after a TBD second countdown to ensure safe initiation.
The UAS shall provide adequate structural support and impact absorption to provide protection for hardware and bystanders in case of accident.
The UAS shall be equipped with proper mounting solutions for sensors.
UAS shall have a battery that is capable of safely providing power to all systems throughout the entire flight.

UAS shall have access to a computer that can adequately handle all computational requirements for drone 
operation.
Systems and motors shall be calibrated to provide specific movement given an input.
UI design shall allow for sending and recieving of signals to and from the UAS.
UAS shall be able to reliably send and recieve all signals over any distance within the operational boundaries.
Motors shall be strong enough to allow the drone to move at speeds greater than the movement speed of the RGV.
UAS shall weigh no more than 55 pounds in order to comply with FAA regulations
UAS shall be able to abort operation
UAS shall have landing gear
UAS propellers shall not interfere with each other or with the aircraft body
UAS vibrations shall be within 0.005 inches of it's center of gravity at the propellers
UAS shall have a diverse array of antennas
Ground station shall have a diverse array of antennas.
UAS shall have a low presence of fibrous materials
UAS shall be able to remain stable while in up to 10mph winds
UAS shall be stable about all axes during operation
All data collected during the mission shall be saved and made available for post processing.
Logged data shall be referenced to the aircraft’s state at the time of recording.
An onboard communications link shall transmit data to the ground station during flight.
The primary sensor shall be used exclusively during coarse localization.
The primary sensor shall not use additional sensing capabilities other than RGB.
The primary sensor shall not directly communicate with a given RGV.
The secondary sensor shall be used exclusively during fine localization.
The secondary sensor shall not directly communicate with a given RGV.
Each RGV shall be identified during the course of the mission.
The primary sensor shall provide state estimates of the RGV during trailing.
Each RGV shall be trailed during the course of the mission.
The UAS shall complete coarse localization within 60 seconds.
Coarse localization sensing data shall be acquired exclusively by the primary sensor.
The primary sensor shall record data at multiple aerial locations along an orbiting flight path.
Once the RGV is coarsely localized, the inertial estimation of the RGV shall be accurate to within a 5 meter radius.
Passive or active emitters mounted to the RGV shall not be used for coarse localization.
Each RGV shall be coarsely localized during the course of the mission.
The UAS shall complete fine localization within 30 seconds.
Fine localization sensing data shall be acquired exclusively by the secondary sensor
The secondary sensor shall record data at multiple locations along an informed flight path.
Fine localization shall provide an increase in accuracy for the RGVs inertial estimation to within 1 meter.
Each RGV shall be finely localized during the course of the mission.
The UAS shall complete joint localization of both RGVs within 20 seconds.
Joint localization shall provide an inertial estimate of both RGVs to within a 2 meter radius.
The sensor used for joint localization shall have a field of view that encompasses the entire mission area in the frame from a height of 60 ft. (~121°).
All radio frequency transmission shall have a frequency within a permissible bandwidth as defined by the FCC (2.4 or 5 GHz).
